text:
Bowery, north from but not including East 1st., Street, as seen from the East Houston Street Station of the Third Ave., Elevated. Shown in the background is the Metropolitan, New York Life and the Consolidated Gas Company Buildings. Cooper Union Institute is seen at the bend of the Elevated structure.

September 10, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Bowery - 1st Street (East)

text:
(1)

Bowery, east side, north from and including East 1st Street, to Cooper Square. The Empire State Building is shown overshadowing the Metropolitan Building.

May 9, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)

The same, a different perspective of the N.E. corner. Also shown is East 1st Street, at, adjoining and east of the N.E. corner of the Bowery.

October 12, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)

The same as No. 2, slightly more inclusive.

September 20, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

title: Manhattan: Bowery - 1st Street (East)

text:
(1)
1-9 2nd Street, at, adjoining, and east of the S.E. corner of the Bowery. Nos. 5-9 are 2½ story frame houses.

1932.

J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.

(2)
A rear view of the same houses.

1932.

J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.

title: Manhattan: Bleecker Street - Bowery

text:
(1) 303-295 Bowery, at, adjoining and south of the S.E. corner of East 1st Street. September 20, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) 295-297 Bowery, as seen in No. 1, and showing the book store at No. 297. May 9, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Bowery - 1st Street (East)

title: Manhattan: Bowery - 1st Street (East)

text:
Bowery, east side, north from and including East 2nd Street.

May 9, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Bowery - 2nd Street (East)

text:
East 2nd Street, east from the Bowery and showing a gasoline station under construction at the S.E. corner. This cleared area included a row of old 2? story frame and brick buildings that were at the extremity of Extra Place. The buildings on the opposite side hide the Marble Cemetery which is in the center of that block and is a forgotten God's acre.

No. 2 depicts a portion of the view seen in No. 1 and includes buildings numbered 14 to 22 inclusive. The photographer is at the northern extremity of Extra Place and is viewing northward across the clearance seen in No. 1.

No.3 is westward from the same vantage point taken in No. 2 though in a westward direction, to and across the Bowery. Past that point, this thoroughfare becomes Bond Street. The building at the N.W. corner of that street and the Bowery is a bank, name unknown to the writer. Note the Third Avenue elevated line running north and southward on the Bowery.

July 16, 1938.
Views 1, 2, and 3.

P.L. Sperr

title: Manhattan: 2nd Street - Bowery

text:
The Bowery, east side, north from and across East 1st Street.  To the left appears the Empire State and the Metropolitan Life Insurance Bldg's. across the Third Avenue elevated lines which runs on the Bowery and continues northward on Third Avenue from Cooper Square.

July 16, 1938
Views 1, 2 and 3

P.L. Sperr
